page.title: 05FARMS AROUND HIGHAM FERRERS
page.content:
The land to the east of Higham Ferrers is mostly used for farming. Farms have changed a lot since the first Domesday Book. Nowadays farmers have lots of machinery that is essential to a modern farm, enabling the land to be intensively farmed by very few people e.g. 1 farmer can cover 160 acres.
In Autunm the farmers need a drill and in Summer a combine harvester. After harvest the stubble is burnt sending black ashes flying through the air making driving difficult and clean washing dirty.
Crops (e.g. wheat) have been troubled with pests, especially Aphids. Alot of farmers keep animals as well as growing crops. Cows are the most popular, then sheep. Not many farmers keep pigs because they are not always healthy.
